advisory: Farmers should maintain 5 cm water level in rice field for proper growth.
Disease Management: Bacterial leaf blight attack should be treated with Copper Oxychloride and Streptocycline under clear and calm weather.
Pest Management: Case worm attack should be treated with Fipronil or Profenofos under clear weather.
For gall midge attack, spray thiamethoxam, Fipronil, or Chloropyriphos under clear and calm weather condition.
To control flower drop, use Plantofix after sowing.
To control sucking insect pests, apply Neem based pesticide at specified stages.
Avoid chemical application at initial flowering stage.
Use Neem based pesticide to control Fruit and shoot borer in various vegetables.
For sucking insect pests, spray thiamethoxam or imidacloprid per liter of water.
Use Carbendazim or copper oxicloride for wilt and root rot control under no rainfall condition.
Prevention and control measures for Mastitis disease include proper sanitation and feeding adjustments.
Ensure fresh water availability and consult a doctor from nearby animal health center in severe cases.
